events.title: Henry IV Crowned King of England
events.description: Henry Bolingbroke is crowned King Henry IV, marking the beginning of the Lancastrian dynasty after deposing King Richard II.
events.significance: This event led to significant political shifts and conflicts in England, including the Wars of the Roses.

events.title: Munich Agreement Signed
events.description: The Munich Agreement is signed by Germany, the United Kingdom, France, and Italy, allowing Nazi Germany to annex the Sudetenland region of Czechoslovakia.
events.significance: This act of appeasement failed to prevent World War II and is often cited as a major diplomatic failure.

events.title: Pakistan Admitted to United Nations
events.description: Pakistan becomes a member of the United Nations, shortly after its independence from British India in 1947.
events.significance: Marking Pakistan's entry onto the international stage as a sovereign nation.

events.title: Luna 11 Launched by Soviet Union
events.description: The Soviet Luna 11 mission is launched to orbit the Moon and conduct scientific experiments.
events.significance: Contributed to the early exploration and understanding of the Moon during the space race.

events.title: Steve Fossett Becomes the First Person to Fly Solo Nonstop Around the World in a Balloon
events.description: Steve Fossett completes the first nonstop solo circumnavigation of the globe in a balloon, the Spirit of Freedom.
events.significance: A major milestone in aviation history showcasing human endurance and navigational skill.
